entry.title: [wallets] Make clientId and configURL optional for Wallets
entry.content:
In this CL, we make clientId and configURL optional fields for

wallets, while keeping them required by federated identity providers.



We accomplish that by removing the WebIDL "required" property and

check at runtime if they are available for federated providers, while

skipping that check for wallet providers.



With that, we make this change backwards compatible while allowing

non-federated providers to avoid passing unnecessary fields.



Note: this CL changes a bit how we are counting UseCounter::Count(context, WebFeature::kFedCm) in that it can over-count invocations that would previously be Type errors before counting to post-counting. Given that the Wallet API is behind a flag, we don't expect this to have any effect in practice.



Change-Id: I8b66fac34fe6fd9f1c3158b0787d8ea81e2f2212

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4808508

Reviewed-by: Nicolás Peña

Commit-Queue: Sam Goto

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1189243}

entry.title: snap-group: Encapsulate `OverviewItem` handlings details
entry.content:
This cl extracts the details to be handled in `OverviewItem` from

`OverviewGrid` when performing continuous scrolling. As the current

implementation goes too deep into `OverviewItem`, it's out of the

responsibility scope of `OverviewGrid`, which will introduce more

problem with the integration of overview group item. We should

clear the boundaries between the two modules.



Fixed: b/297427797

Test: Run existing tests

entry.title: Implement Tailored Security retry logic for sync users
entry.content:
This change adds retry logic and supporting tests to the tailored

security service. The retry logic will run 2 minutes after the tailored

security service is instantiated.



The logic can initialize and maintain a preference value that controls

when the retry logic can run. Whenever a retry is attempted, the next

attempt value is incremented by a day so that attempts on a given day

are limited to one time.



The new retry logic is guarded by the

`safe_browsing::kTailoredSecurityRetryForSyncUsers` feature.



Change-Id: I58ddc731b44c1ee36a404a63b93fc62005548827

Bug: 1346776

entry.title: Remove broken OCMock usage in TranslateInfobarModalOverlayMediatorTest.
entry.content:
translate_delegate_ is not an OCMock object (it's not even an objective

C object), so calling OCMExpect on it does nothing. This CL removes all

these no-op OCMExpect calls, although a better (but much more involved)

fix would probably be to change translate_delegate_ to a gmock object,

and use gmock to verify what methods are called.



This unblocks updating OCMock to a newer version, which will prevent

these kinds of mistaked from being made in the future.



Bug: 1476506, 1476697

entry.title: Migrate remaining AutocompleteController calls to use native Matches.
entry.content:
This change paves the way for introduction of horizontal rendering

groups. Here, we migrate onSuggestionTouchDown and getMatchingTab

calls to use native AutocompleteMatch objects directly.



The change slightly changes how we capture

- `Android.Omnibox.InvalidMatch` and

- `Android.Omnibox.UsedSuggestionFromCache`

metrics, capturing *every* use of AutocompleteMatch objects, rather

than select ones.



Lastly, the change verifies whether element to be deleted comes from

cache, or is served by native AutocompleteController ahead of

presenting the delete dialog.



Bug: 1474087, 1244577

entry.title: [RemoveLegacy] PaintPropertyTreeBuilderContext always has one fragment
entry.content:
Now PaintPropertyTreeBuilder is called from PrePaintTreeWalk either

for a non-fragmented object or for each fragment of a ng-block-

fragmented object, so it always sees one fragment.



PaintPropertyTreeBuilderFragmentContext is still not folded into

PaintPropertyTreeBuilderContext because hidden svg containers need

the default constructor of the former to initialize an independent

paint property tree builder context. Will consider refactor.

entry.title: Reland "[ChromeRefresh2023] Update document pip windows for Chrome Refresh"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 6ffb7225aa3a3d420b7799e9cd5d5f69952e4a4d



This reland removes the updated color ids since they had multiple issues including making the text/icons on video picture-in-picture windows unreadable. These will be dealt with in a separate CL.

> [ChromeRefresh2023] Update document pip windows for Chrome Refresh

>

> This CL makes a few different UI updates to document picture-in-picture

> windows for Chrome Refresh:

>

> 1) Updates the color of the new pageinfo icon. The new icon has a white

> background that doesn't make sense with PiP always being in dark mode,

> so this adds some code to override into dark colors instead.

>

> 2) Updates the back-to-tab and close button icons.

>

> 3) Updates the margins on the pageinfo button to match new specs.

entry.title: Make glanceable bubble not activatable by default
entry.content:
This is more consistent with other system tray bubbles, which are

activatable only if some accessibility features are enabled, or in

certain cases if showing in response to a keyboard event (e.g. calendar

view). With this change, glanceables bubble will not be activated, or

take focus if shown by click on the date tray. If the bubble gets opened

in response to a keyboard event, the bubble will be activated (to be

consistent with the current calendar view behavior). Additionally, when

creating bubble child views, makes sure that the calendar view is the

first child in the focus list.



Also, use TrayBubbleWrapper to manage glanceables tray bubble widget

(and increase consistency with other bubbles).



This required tweaks to logic that ensured a glanceable bubble does not

scroll out of view if the glanceable size changes in response to the

selected task/coursework list changing. Previously, this was done by

scrolling focused view to visible when the bubble container size

changed. With this CL, the selector may not be focused after the

selection changes (as the bubble may not be active) - instead, now the

bubble is explicitly scrolled to visible when its preferred size changes

after list selection changes initiated by the user.



BUG=b:297227683



Change-Id: I35fa11e0cdc76e3bdabf433969f551ebfbf4b82e

entry.title: [Eche] Fix crash on GetColorProvider() in Error Dialog
entry.content:
A migration from AshColorProvider to ui::ColorProvider caused a crash

when using GetColorProvider(), as that function requires a parent view

to be set to use. Because the Jelly migration has already finished, we

instead will now use cros_tokens so we won't need to follow the view

hierarchy/lifespan for just colors. Doing this also allows us to be able

to support dynamic colors/light-dark mode without relying on

OnThemeChanged(), so that was removed.



Screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9DTt2Gfxq4PnnG6.png



Test: Manually verified that opening the AppStreamErrorDialog no longer

crashes, provided a screenshot.

entry.title: accelerators: Rework launcher handling decision into a state machine
entry.content:
Previously on ChromeOS, the decision whether to toggle the launcher

state was handled by the AcceleratorHistory component which kept track

of all currently pressed keys.



The issue with this component is that it was at a level in the stack where it could potentially miss some real key presses and releases.



This could result in the launcher not being able to be toggled until a

user presses or releases the exact key which was not recorded by

AcceleratorHistory which lead to a lot of frustration as the key was

difficult to track down.



To detect when "No keys are pressed", a new API was added to the

InputController which notes when any keys are physically pressed on any

keyboard connected to the system.



Bug: b/285970320

Change-Id: Id64bb198a9385c68690cb33d4c5a71b9bd28e866

entry.title: Do less in perf test tall-content-short-columns.html
entry.content:
Change the test so that it can do about one run per second, instead of

taking forever (I waited about a minute without any output, so I gave

up). Also remove the short piece of text inside the tall block, to keep

it pure and simple.



This test is useful for measuring performance scalability issues when

many fragmentainers are involved, but it became way too slow with

LayoutNGBlockFragmentation. It is acceptable that NG block frag is

slower at such tests, since we now actually have to perform some layout

per fragmentainer. But we can do better. There are multiple separate

O(n^2) issues, both in layout, pre-paint and paint.



There will be CLs coming up, that will improve the speed of this test

drastically.



Change-Id: Ieeb3662fd06651e466c9bb0ebca8fbbc5a719c4f

entry.title: themes: Simply and fix logic for tabs and NewTabButton.
entry.content:
The CL makes two changes:



(1) It removes logic in TabStrip::GetCustomBackgroundId related to

IDR_THEME_TAB_BACKGROUND_V. IDR_THEME_TAB_BACKGROUND_V was intended for

compatibility with windows aero glass theme for Windows Vista

(translucent tab strip). Chrome no longer supports Windows Vista, nor a

translucent tab strip. This was preventing themes with images from

replacing the background of inactive tabs and the new tab button.



For more context on the original intention of this logic, see:

https://codereview.chromium.org/67284/

https://codereview.chromium.org/9252026/



For the CL where we modified the original logic into a form closer to

the current logic, see the next CL. This was where the original meaning

got changed, and eventually lost.

https://codereview.chromium.org/136093007/



(2) This CL simplifies and fixes the theme-painting logic in

NewTabButton. This CL adds documentation.



For a before/after, see https://imgur.com/a/cswynbD. Before on left,

after on right.



Change-Id: I0873cb375490912991a0f361e3e1f5b4fcad2ddf

occurring on /foo/bar. This is only supported on some platforms.

common in real-life media, to the point where I think that addressing it

is actually something that needs to be done before launch. I also

re-adjusted the buffering and delay numbers to perform better on slower

internet speeds on random HLS samples from around the web.



Also remove the thread check on IsSeekable, since that can be

called from multiple threads.

entry.title: [Default Nav Transition] Let surface pick up the exact CopyOutRequest.
entry.content:
Before this change the arrived exact request will be queued up the

CompositorFrameSinkSupport before it is picked up by the targeted

surface. This CL makes sure that the exact request is picked up upon

arrival.



In a cross-renderer navigation, the old document will be unloaded in the

old renderer, thus tearing down the old CompositorFrameSink. If we then

submit a copy request, that request will have no

CompositorFrameSinkSupport to go, even though the targeted surface is

still alive.



Bug: 1414172, 1465547

Low-Coverage-Reason: the feature CL on top of this will have full tests.

Change-Id: I56578c7bf82277661ed35c81b168606663827f6e

entry.title: IndexedDB: fix hang in IndexedDBConnectionCoordinator
entry.content:
Whenever `state_` changes*, aside from inside the Perform() method,

`tasks_available_callback_` must be run. After

crrev.com/01b94c0abfb5d620a5b2122fe0dd122bfbb90753 some codepaths

within Perform() became asynchronous which were previously always

synchronous. This change adds some more invocations of this callback

which have therefore become necessary.



*except if it changes from one type of "pending async work" to another,

which is why you might notice that occasionally the callback is not

run after updating `state_`.



Aside from fixing a real problem, this should also fix flakiness in

transaction-abort-generator-revert.html



credit to jsbell@chromium.org for the reduction.



Bug: 1472028,1466727

entry.title: [Extensions] Use proper v8::Context when checking web socket activity
entry.content:
Service worker-based extensions reset their idle timer with web socket

activity, including both outgoing and incoming messages. We check if the

service worker idle timer should be reset based on the v8::Context: if

the context is the service worker of an extension, we reset the timer.



However, there was a bug in how we were determining the context. In some

cases for server-sent messages, it was possible the v8::Context of the

web socket is not the currently-active v8::Context in the isolate.

Instead of grabbing the context via the isolate's current context for

the thread, use the ScriptState associated with the

ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.



Add a regression test for this scenario. This involved adding a new

test web socket scenario to //net/data/websocket that sends a message

every quarter second up to times, where is a value supplied by

the web socket opener. We use this in the test to validate that the

connection (and service worker) can stay open for a period of time

longer than the service worker idle timeout while the worker isn't doing

anything else to reset the timer.



Bug: 1476142

Change-Id: I1477f07056310659032b6da0ed897c2becafba03

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4813451

Reviewed-by: Tim

entry.title: Fix transition-behavior perf regression
entry.content:
When I implemented transition-behavior (then called

transition-animation-type) in http://crrev.com/1168211, I made

transition:all start expanding not to just interpolable properties, but

all discrete properties as well. This has increased the number of

properties for transition:all from 141 to 415 properties, which caused a

perf regression.



This patch fixes this regression by only expanding transition:all to the

full list of 415 properties when transition-behavior:allow-discrete is

specified, which is the only time when all of those properties are

actually needed.



Fixed: 1465145

Change-Id: Ib34b78843b48bc90f3f4bb171cedfd79af4f8192

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4735153

Reviewed-by: Robert Flack

Commit-Queue: Joey Arhar

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1189141}

vptr/1/overview



It means the fix will make failed trybots linux-ubsan-vptr to pass.



Crash reason:

Crash happens because we set CVC in onCreditCardFetched function in

BrowserAutofillManager while credit_card might be nullptr at that point.

We should check result != success before

setting CVC.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[CVV Storage] Refactor OnCreditCardFetched function"

>

> This reverts commit 0eca3788ce496446ad11ed45a194c754e55d4e8a.

>

> Reason for revert: suspect of causing breakage for `All/CardMetadataFormEventMetricsTest.LogSelectedMetrics/*` tests on https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-ubsan-vptr.

>

> First failure at https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-ubsan-vptr/25209/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > [CVV Storage] Refactor OnCreditCardFetched function

> >

> > 1. Remove CVC parameter

> > 2. Set CVC in CreditCard Object before calling OnCreditCardFetched

> > function. Impacted flows: ServerCard CVC Auth, ServerCard Fido Auth,

> > VirtualCard Otp Auth.

> > 3. Retrieve CVC from CreditCard Object instead of CVV parameter

> >

> > Without CVC parameter, we are not confused with whether it's server card

> > cvc or local card cvc.

> >

> > 15 results of onCreditCardFethced function usage:

> > https://source.chromium.org/search?

> > q=oncreditcardfetched&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc&start=1

> >

> > Will refactor CachedServerCardInfo,

> > VirtualCardManualFallbackBubbleOptions,

> > OnDeviceAuthenticationResponseForFilling in follow up CL:

> > https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1473481

> >

entry.title: ui: simplify TreeModelObserver
entry.content:
In particular:

* Remove support for batched updates from the observer interface; the

TreeModel class itself does not support these so in practice only

updates of size 1 can be observed

* Give the observer methods empty default bodies

* Simplify some logic in TreeView, since it no longer needs to account

for possible batched updates to its TreeModel

entry.title: Setting CSS value using cssom should show deprecation warning
entry.content:
We want to count usage for deprecated CSS values that are set

using CSSOM:

* .setProperty('appearance', val)

* style.appearance = val`



This patch changes the following functions so we can pass the

CSSParserContext from CSSParser::ParseValue to the

CSSParserFastPaths::ParseKeywordValue. This way, once we have confirmed

the CSS value is valid, we can count the feature usage and show the

console warning for upcoming deprecation.



CSSParser::ParseValue()

CSSParserFastPaths::MaybeParseValue()

-> Pass `const CSSParserContext* context` instead of `CSSParserMode parser_mode`

CSSParserFastPaths::ParseKeywordValue()

-> Pass `const CSSParserContext* context` instead of `CSSParserMode parser_mode`

CSSParserFastPaths::IsValidKeywordPropertyAndValue()



Change-Id: I84329cc05ee391d4bf99cfc9243fdb69d01c8a8d

entry.content:

up state in ContextDestroyed(). start() is also changed to return a

rejected promise if the detector's context is destroyed.

before detach with a signal and again after detach without a signal.

entry.title: Prevent scoped probe parameters from binding to rvalues
entry.content:
Scoped probes are stack-only, so generally retaining references

in scoped probes is ok. However, some scoped probes were retaining

references to rvalues produced while evaluating constructor arguments,

which results in a stack UaF in case such value is referenced outside

of `Will(Probe&)` methods.



This accepts references passed to probes via std::reference_wrapper<>

that does not bind to rvalues and fixes few issues that were detected.

entry.title: [GM3] Set ThemeID for UserColor themes
entry.content:
The appearance section of the settings page is currently dependent on

ThemeID to know whether the theme is default or not. This experience

probably overall needs an update, but settings ThemeID for GM3 color and

checking for it at least sets the experience back to matching GM2.



Without this change, the "Reset to default"/"Reset to classic" button

does not appear in chrome://settings/appearance with a GM3 theme.



I did not add to the browser test since the browser test for the button

showing still works, since the button existing depends more on ThemeID

being set at all. The value is only for the "Chrome Colors" text.

entry.title: Notify GC about external memory allocated on font objects
entry.content:
GC is not aware of the amount of memory allocated for the font objects.

Therefore, when a lot of font objects are created, for example, during

heavy animation of variable web fonts, see [0], memory is growing

unboundedly, without GC kicking in, until the tab crashes.



We have two types of large allocations related to the font objects:

First, when we decode font resource, we allocate decoded resource size

of bytes for the new instance of SkData [1].



Second, during the animation of variable web fonts a lot of

SimpleFontData objects are created, one per each animation frame. Each

time we create new SimpleFontData object, we will invoke

SkFont::getWidthsBounds() to get the width for zero and space glyph,

compare [2] and [3]. Then, in ScalerContext_FreeType::generateMetrics(),

Skia will ask FreeType to get glyphs metrics by invoking

af_face_globals_get_metrics, see [4]. In af_face_globals_get_metrics,

will allocate style_metrics_size bytes of memory on the metrics, compare

[5].



To prevent the unbounded growth of memory, we need to inform GC about

external memory allocated on font objects. This CL notifies GC about the

amount of memory allocated on Font objects when the font resource is

decoded and when SimpleFontData objects are created. In the first case

we are using the size of the network resource as the amount of memory

allocated on the font objects. In the second case we use max value of

style_metrics_size [6] for that purpose.



Test: manually tested on

third_party/blink/web_tests/http/tests/ManualTests/fonts/leakyvar.html

before the change memory would grow up to 15GB and then the tab would

crash, after the change memory stays under 350MB.



[0] https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=778352#c59

[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/css/remote_font_face_source.cc?q=RemoteFontFaceSource::NotifyFinished&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/fonts/simple_font_data.cc?q=WidthForGlyph%5C(space_glyph_%5C)&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/fonts/simple_font_data.cc?q=WidthForGlyph%5C(zero_glyph_%5C)&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc

[4] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/freetype/src/src/autofit/afglobal.c?q=af_face_globals_get_metrics&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc

[5] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/freetype/src/src/autofit/afglobal.c?q=style_metrics_size&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc

[6] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/freetype/src/src/autofit/aftypes.h?q=style_metrics_size&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc



Bug: 1429581

Change-Id: I0fb90931c8a011d495dea113a586c0e51ec16309

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4717485

entry.title: Allow partitioned storage by default when 3p cookies are disabled
entry.content:
Blocking third-party cookies by default (ex: through the toggle in a new

incognito tab) currently disabled all third-party storage as well.



This CL allows access to partitioned storage when third-party cookies

are disabled by default.



This only applies when third-party cookies are disabled by default

across all urls. If cookies are disabled through a user specified rule/pattern then storage will continue to be disabled as well.

entry.title: Use opt guide model for speculation-rule preloading heuristics.
entry.content:
In this CL we use `PreloadingModelHandler` class to predict next clicks

using the preloading heuristics ML model.



The CL may look like a lot of changes are introduced, and it is mainly

caused by renaming `PreloadingDecider` to `PreloadingDeciderImpl` and

adding an interface class for it. Otherwise, the main changes are in:



chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/preloading_model_keyed_service.cc

chrome/browser/navigation_predictor/preloading_model_keyed_service.cc

third_party/blink/renderer/core/html/anchor_element_metrics_sender.cc

entry.title: [omnibox][webui] Clamp bounds height using initial calculated max size
entry.content:
This fixes a strange sizing issue that only showed up on some machines.

The original calculated height is what we used exclusively before

making the size dynamic, and this change limits the widget height

to not exceed that. No special consideration is given for frame,

shadows, etc., this is just a stopgap fix before eliminating the

Views-based rendering altogether in next steps.

entry.title: Rename *DirAttributeDirty methods on document to *HasDirAttribute.
entry.content:
Prior to this change, the names of these methods (and the matching

member variable) claim to be tracking "dirty" state, but the state is

never cleared (and there isn't a logical place where it *would* be

cleared). This means they actually track whether the page has a dir

attribute at all.



The two callers that use this state appear that they wouldn't work

correctly if the state were cleared.



Therefore, this change renames the methods and member variable to make

it clear that they track permanent state rather than temporary "dirty"

state.

entry.title: FSA: Implement FileSystemObserver.unobserve()
entry.content:
Good-enough implementation of the unobserve() method. It's possible for

events to be relayed to the renderer in the time between when the

Unobserve() IPC is posted and when the observation is removed in the

browser process. A more "correct" implementation will require more

invasive changes such as queueing in the renderer - to be left for a

follow-up CL.

entry.title: [QuickStart] Fix redundant SessionContext instantiation
entry.content:
The SessionContext object is already created when the session_context_

variable is declared in the .h file. Since the first instantiation

clears the local state prefs needed for resuming after a forced update,

this redundant instantiation overwrites the context from the previous

connection and generates new session context info instead.
